00015 #ifndef __MEZZO_DISK_IO
00016 #define __MEZZO_DISK_IO__
00017 
00018 #include <vector>
00019 
00020 #include "SeqDataFileBlock.h"
00021 
00022 namespace Mezzo {
00023 
00024 class DiskIO;
00025 
00026 // There is only one global DiskIO object
00027 extern DiskIO *gDiskIO;
00028 
00029 class DiskIOCallable {
00030  public:
00031    virtual void HandleDiskIOTasks() = 0;
00032 };
00033 
00034 struct CallableProcess {
00035    int priority;
00036    DiskIOCallable *callable;
00037 };
00038 
00039 class DiskIO {
00040  public:
00041    DiskIO();
00042    ~DiskIO();
00043 
00044    // The client program should call this method on gDiskIO
00045    // from a separate thread.  (Starting a new thread is a
00046    // platform-dependent operation.)
00047    void Run();
00048 
00049    void RegisterCallable(DiskIOCallable *callable, int priority);
00050    void UnregisterCallable(DiskIOCallable *callable);
00051 
00052    //
00053    // Thread-safe methods that can be called by the GUI thread when it
00054    // creates new block files or modifies priority information about 
00055    // existing block files.
00056    //
00057 
00058    // This must be called when a new SeqDataFileBlock is created,
00059    // so that DiskIO knows to manage it and eventually garbage-collect it.
00060    void EnqueueNewBlock(SeqDataFileBlock *newBlock);
00061 
00062  private:
00063    static int msDiskIOCount; // Make sure we're a singleton
00064 
00065    std::vector<CallableProcess> mProcesses;
00066 };
00067 
00068 } // Namespace Mezzo
00069 
00070 #endif
